187256.・購入した時点から 利用券は有効となり\n ご利用中のアカウントにのみ 反映され:
・The ticket is valid from the time of
  purchase and will only be applied to your
  current account.
　
・The number of days of the ticket is
  calculated from the purchase date and valid
  until 24:00 on the day the ticket expires.
　
・However, if you purchase an additional usage
  ticket while the validity period is still
  remaining, the period of the purchased
  ticket will be added to the validity period.
　
・Tickets whose validity period exceeds <%dMAXDAY>
  days cannot be purchased.

Indication based on the Act on Specified Commercial Transactions Name of the business: Nintendo Company, Limited Representative:
Shuntaro Furukawa, President Location: 11-1 Kamitoba Hokotachi-cho, Minami-ku, Kyoto, Japan Telephone number: 0570-011-120 (Navi
Dial) The price of each software/data is displayed on the product page of each software/data... The customer shall be
responsible for all Internet connection and communication fees required for the use of each software and data.... If other fees are
required, they will be indicated on the product page of each software or data... Time and method of payment You may add (register)
your balance in advance at the Nintendo eShop or our website, and then use (pay in advance) the amount equivalent to the consideration
from the unused balance (You may also add (register) your balance from certain software... (Note that the balance can also
be added (registered) from the specific software. When will the software/data be made available? The software/data will be made
available on compatible devices immediately after payment for the software/data is made... However, if a specific time of
provision is specified in the purchase procedure, the provision will start at that time... Operating Environment for Software
and Data Provided by the Company In order to run additional data provided for specific software, such as additional content and usage tickets, you must also prepare the relevant software in advance... Although Nintendo Accounts can be linked to multiple Nintendo Switch systems, purchased software and data for Nintendo Switch will, in principle, only run on the Nintendo Switch system registered as a downloadable system... Other system requirements are indicated on the product page of each software and data... Terms and Conditions of Sale When purchasing software and data for Nintendo 3DS or Wii U from the Company's website, you must link the Nintendo Network ID registered on the device that can run the software and data to your Nintendo Account and consolidate the balance. You must have completed this procedure... If the purchase of software or data for Nintendo 3DS or Wii U is restricted by the "Parental Controls" setting on the relevant device, you will not be able to purchase such software or data. In the case of purchases from the Nintendo Switch or the Company's website, if purchase functions are restricted due to the "Parental Controls" setting on the Nintendo Account, you will not be able to purchase... Please note that the Nintendo Account Terms of Use will apply to purchases made from the Nintendo Switch and our website. The Nintendo Network Terms of Service will apply to purchases made from the Wii U. However, if you link your Nintendo Network ID to your Nintendo Account and consolidate your balance, the Nintendo Account Terms of Service will apply.... Cancellation/Return Cancellation or return for the convenience of the customer after purchase will not be accepted... The Company shall not be liable for any defect in the software or data... However, except in the case of intentional or gross negligence on the part of the Company, the scope of the Company's liability to the customer for damages shall be limited to damages that would normally occur to the customer (lost profits, lost opportunities, etc. are outside the scope of damages) and shall not include special damages. Special damages are not included. In the event that the Company is liable for damages, the Company's maximum liability shall be the amount paid by the customer to the Company in the month in which the damage occurred or 10,000 yen, whichever is lower (provided, however, that this shall not apply in the event that the Company is intentionally or grossly negligent...). .
